intro: Coussapoa curranii, commonly known as the Curran's coussapoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
